cause.description:
According to the US Census, Washington, DC has the 3rd highest poverty rate nationwide, and the highest childhood poverty rate nationwide.
In Washington, DC, the total number of homeless families has increased 13.5 percent from 2004 to 2006. This is the 5th year in a row for that number to increase (Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments).
In the past 4 years, at least 12,000 affordable housing units have disappeared from the Washington, DC housing market (DC Fiscal Policy Institute).
According to the Economic Policy Institute, a 2 parent, 2 child household needs to earn approximately $63,192 to be able to afford its basic necessities.
The average Bread for the City client's household income?
$7,000.
Food & Clothing, Legal, Medical, and Social Services.
Thanks to the efforts of hundreds of volunteers and the contributions of thousands in the community, Bread for the City helps more than 10,000 people each month.
1. Bread for the City provides vulnerable residents of Washington, DC with comprehensive services in an atmosphere of dignity and respect.
2. All people share a common humanity, and all are responsible to themselves and to society as a whole.
3. We promote the collaboration of clients, volunteers, donors, staff, and other community partners to alleviate the suffering caused by poverty and to rectify the conditions that perpetuate it.
cause.mission: Provide free food, clothing, legal, medical, and social services to low-income DC residents.
cause.name: Help Bread for the City Help Others
